//Import the required components import React from 'react'; import {makeStyles} from '@material-ui/core/styles'; import {Typography, Box, Grid, Card, CardActionArea, CardActions, CardContent, CardMedia, Button, Avatar} from '@material-ui/core'; import Navbar from '../navbar/navbar'; import G20IMG from '../images/g20IMG.jpg'; import { deepOrange, deepPurple } from '@material-ui/core/colors'; //CSS Styles const useStyles = makeStyles(theme => ({ datasciCard: { color: theme.palette.getContrastText(deepOrange[500]), backgroundColor: deepOrange[500], }, mainContainer: { background: '#223', height: '100%', }, cardContainer: { maxWidth: 450, margin: '3rem auto' }, header: { fontSize: '1.5rem', fontWeight: 'bold', }, headerContainer: { margin: '1.2rem 0', display: 'flex' }, cardContent: { fontSize: '0.9rem', }, subHeading: { fontSize: '1rem', fontWeight: 'bold' }, })) const Projects = () => { const classes = useStyles(); return ( {/* Project 1 */} D G20 Text Analysis Every few years leaders throughout the globe meet for a summit to discuss world issues. The recent G20 Summit held in Osaka commenced on the 28th Jun 2019. This is the few times that every leader in the world so most of the global issues will be covered during this meeting. Things such as world hunger, third world poverty and climate change are all common topics for this summit.
Why use programming to solve this issue? This was such a wide scale event covered by almost every main country such as Japan, Korea, USA, Australia just to name a few. This would mean that thousands of news outlets across the world would release articles on this particular event. Sure it would be possible G20 Text Analysis Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. ); } export default Projects;
